commitResults.messageTitle: Level-1: Greet, Echo, Exit complete
Implemented level 2
Added Task.java, edited some UI elements of Duke.java, implemented level 3
Added Deadline Event Todo that extend Task. Completed Level 4 functionality
Automated testing doesn't work, script is broken and requires manual calling of FC with direct address
Added basic error handling
Level-6 completed. Outstanding issues for future weeks; error checking is currently very basic and automated script does not work.

Error checking is now more comprehensive, updated the input and expected text for automated checking to now do a basic check covering Todo, Deadline, Event tasks, as well as done and delete functionality
Refactored out direct ArrayList management to TaskList class.
Save Load functionality, added some minor functionalities to the Todo Event Deadline classes, made the Task class abstract.
Minimal date functionality for event and deadline. Can understand format yyyy-mm-dd and prints in MMM dd yyyy.
Created Ui Class with basic functionality. Some aspects of Ui handling not yet ported over completely.
Refactored Ui slightly to make seperation of concerns more clean. Parser class initialised but still blank at this point
Parser and command logic drafted. Not yet implemented; this commit is before the significant refactoring of Duke.java

Adding delete and event commands are currently broken. I want to shift date understanding to the parser instead of in the delete/event classes in any case. Save load also not implemented yet, but basic add, mark done, delete, list commands are up and running
Removed a lot of code that is no longer relevant, add deadline/event are functional again. Last outstanding part of refactor is to make save/load work with new structure.

Save and load functionality is back. Main remaining issues before OOP refactor is complete is a few more print statements to be handed to ui, redoing how exceptions are handled, and adding a few more exception checks (delete IOOB not caught right now)
All exception handling shifted to Main, all ui duties now correctly with Ui class, basic functionalities up to level 8 are all in place.
divided classes into packages
Found and fixed print formatting bugs. Implemented junit tests for AddCommand, one test for each existing type of task.
More unit tests added, checking some basic aspects of Parser functionality
Added displayline functionality to UI after seeing how the jar file looks in a terminal. Tested jar and it appears to satisfy basic functionality.
Added javadocs to the command package
Added find functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
FindCommand class added, containing the logic for the new function.
Parser class changed to recognize the find command and added method
to Ui class for displaying the found items.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added javadocs to the task package
Javadocs for remaining classes added
commitResults.messageBody:
Documents for public methods in ui and tasklist that are very
self-explanatory have been omitted.

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated code to improve style
commitResults.messageBody:
Changed naming of test methods, edited use of white space to match
given style guide.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Launcher.java and fixed some bugs
commitResults.messageBody:
After all the chain of commits, some places invoked the Storage
constructor without the correct number of arguments. Deadline and
Event were also bugged due to not calling parent constructor.

Bugs fixed and program passes test suite again. Basic UI display
is now functional.

commitResults.messageTitle: Complete JavaFX part 2
Part3 Iteration 1
Javafx Part 3 Iteration 2
Javafx Part 3 Iteration 3
Complete Javafx tutorial
Refactor app to work with GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
Main class has switched following the JavaFX tutorial. Requires
refactoring of UI class that handled printing to screen and some
rewriting of command execute logic.

UI object now handles generating the correct strings, and returns
them to the GUI half to display instead of printing it directly.

Done this way since the UI class was already responsible for
correctly formatting messages, allowed sensible reuse of existing
codebase.

Some functionality left to be done; load functionality and exit
functionality is not properly present. Some Ui commands are also
not fully operational and display placeholder messages.

commitResults.messageTitle: Complete basic GUI implementation
commitResults.messageBody:
All basic features are now operational and display correctly.
Remaining significant issue is that text in GUI display does not
resize automatically and only shows a tiny bit of text.

commitResults.messageTitle: Gradle run implemented
commitResults.messageBody:
Gradle build will be left until checkstyle and other things are
complete.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tidy codebase to match checkstyle
Implement gradle build and remove checkstyle errors
commitResults.messageBody: All remaining checkstyle errors fixed, gradle build successful

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Ui class
commitResults.messageBody:
A number of methods became deprecated after unnecessarily
implementing javaFX.

Deprecated methods that are no longer needed have been removed.

Done to improve code quality.

Removing javaFX will improve the experience for everyone.

commitResults.messageTitle: AddCommand: add assert to command flow
commitResults.messageBody:
If else chain used an else clause, instead of explicitly checking
that the type was "event". This could result in problems if the
type was not one of the three recognised types.

The assumption is now explicit. The code checks sequentially
for each of the three accepted types, and uses an assertion
where the code should not execute.

This checks for a serious error in the execution, since it means a
command was incorrectly parsed as an AddCommand when the syntax was
incorrect.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Parser class
commitResults.messageBody:
Readability of parse method was very poor with many nested if
else clauses and poor application of SLAP.

Code has been refactored to improve readability and if else clauses
changed to switch clauses.

Done to improve readability, simplify future additions and
make maintainance easier.

Refactoring broke invalidcommand, deadline and event logic. To
be fixed next.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bugs from refactor and associated bugs uncovered
commitResults.messageBody:
Refactor of parse method broke some functions of the application.

Issue was caused by split removing spaces, and join not re-adding
the spaces. In addition, realised that exceptions thrown were not
properly printing error messages to the user.

All the above listed issues were fixed. Errors are now printed
to the user correctly, and when using join, removed spaces are
re-included.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove debug print statements
commitResults.messageBody: Leftover code from fixing bugs was removed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement basic update command
commitResults.messageBody:
It is now possible to update the description of existing items
in the tasklist.

Error handling and implementation of updating dates is next.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement C-Update
commitResults.messageBody:
Implementation of update functionality for BCD-extension
requirement.

Date is now a universal feature of Tasks. Asserts have been
added to Todo class to ensure date related methods are not wrongly
called on Todo Tasks in the program.

Done this way since more Tasks (Deadline, Event) have dates then
tasks that do not (Todo).

Uncovered bugs in parser error reporting logic. Have documented
them in comments to be solved at a future date.
